description: Excellent coffee and pastries. I did get 2 Canadian quarters (which don't work in my laundry machine) while breaking a $20 for quarters using the machine in the back, but I think the coffee and the convenience of being able to get change while sipping a delicious cappuccino more than makes up for it.
author: Gleb P.

description:
A great little cafe situated in one corner of a laundromat. I never thought I'd be a fan of any eatery located inside of a laundromat, but I was wrong. I've been here about a dozen times.

The lattes and coffee are solid (good but not the best I've ever had). The cafe has a wide selection of base goods, including gluten free Dynamo Donuts! The Lemon Powered Donut is amazing.
author: Enrique F.

description:
This has been my go-to laundromat for years, but recently they have seriously gone downhill as they seem to be catering more to their coffee customers than to people who actually go there to do their laundry. 

They removed the counter where you fold your clothes and replaced it with tables and chairs, and then removed a bunch of washing machines and replaced them with a counter with chalkboards on the front. If you try folding your clothes here, you'll get chalk all over the front of your pants! Whose bright idea was this??

There are always several washers and dryers out of order, including the 50 lb. washer that I like to use, which has been out of commission the last several times I've visited.

Oh, and the barista has a bit of an attitude. I once heard her tell a customer who ordered a fancy drink that maybe she ought to go to Starbucks instead!
author: Dave H.

description:
NOLA Coffee (iced coffee, almond milk, half/half) 
Stumbled upon this coffee shop while visiting another establishment. Very cute place. Hipster sort of vibe. Coffee was reasonably priced - the barista explained the menu and was super polite. Plenty of parking which is a plus! I will certainly be back :)
author: Kristina M.

description:
Wow.

I've been doing my laundry here for a few years now and the only reason is its proximity to my home. It's a pretty poorly run operation. On any given day at least 40-50% of the washers and dryers are out of order. The ATM doesn't work either. Thankfully, the change machine was always functioning.  I'm not sure if the coffee is a separate business from the laundromat, but the coffee is good. Now comes the 'wow' part. A few weeks ago I noticed a washer that wasn't draining and had standing, discolored water in it. It had probably been like that for at least a few days or more. I remember mentioning it to someone that worked there. I stumbled upon the same washer again today, at least a few weeks later. The water is still there, was an opaque black color, and had a mat of mold or something equally nasty on top (see photos below). Truly horrific with a literally breath-taking smell.  I mentioned it to the woman who was working there and she thanked me for informing her (in her most patronizing tone, I'd wager) and said she was aware and would clean it up. When I mentioned that it was a health hazard to prepare food 10 feet from this mess (black mold, E. coli, mildew, and who knows what else is in there) she again thanked me and went back to talking to her friend. She closed up shop and left a few minutes later. The lack of concern with regard to a toxic situation was also breathtaking. I'm wondering if it will ever be cleaned. I'll never find out but I'm sure the Health Dept. will now that it's on their radar.
author: el r.

description:
This place is awesome! Such a great community spirit, totally welcoming of everyone, great attitude, and the best selection of alternative milks anywhere! They got me totally hooked on oat milk which is just the bomb. So creamy, it's by far the best alternative to dairy to have in your espresso! The pastries are quite decent as well and fun... love this place!

Also good turn around on fluff and fold, this place is a gem
author: Aaron Z.

description:
It was a confusing visit today. I arrived to see they'd removed half of their smaller washers and replaced the large stainless steel folding area with tables for drinking coffee at. They seem to have put some sort of bare wood counter where the washers used to be, but it's also a chalkboard for the neighborhood kids. It feels like this is a clear message that this is not a place for people like me who go there to do laundry. The wood is less than sanitary and I don't want chalk on my clothes or little kids under my legs.

I understand it must be nice to be a part of the  neighborhood, with families stopping by with kids and dogs to buy coffee (who all comment how they love the tables, yet do not sit at them), so maybe that's why they are focusing their business on the coffee part. Because I can't do laundry here anymore, there is no space to fold anything if there are more than two other people doing laundry in there besides you. :(
author: Christopher J.

description:
This is no longer a laundromat. It is a coffee shop with a few sporadically working machines. And calling them 'working' is giving them credit. 

Over the years, I've probably lost $50 because the dryer doesn't heat, washing machine didn't spin, or it didn't have hot, or even warm, water. 

Reviews here that are 4-5 stars are for the coffee...which, fine. But anyone who actually does their laundry here doesn't care about all that. They just want a machine that cleans, rinses, and dries their clothes. 

If the owner simply wants to be a coffee shop, then just do it. Stop half-a**ing the laundromat, or let someone else manage it, because you are definitely not.
author: Adam C.

description:
What a great concept!
Doing laundry sucks when you don't have machines in your building (and, let's be honest, even when you do) but Spin City has such a pleasant environment-and great coffee!  You can come here with a book and actually enjoy your time instead of just getting through the chore so you can go on to something better.  I saw that the hours are pretty dern convenient as well!
author: Allana D.

description: This review is for the coffee shop -- this is the third time I've been here where they serve the people after me in line because those people are regulars and/or know the owner by name.  I would love to keep coming here since it's just around the corner, but waiting for your drink after the people behind you in line receive theirs isn't worth the $4 pour over.
author: jasper s.

description: Just when I didn't think this place could get any worse...I'm currently doing laundry in the dark.
author: Mandy Y.

description:
Is this a coffee house or a place to do laundry well it's actually both and they have wifi good to know they do have a bathroom so you have free access years ago they would give you a key because people would just walk in and use the bathroom. BUT one thing it sucks when they just leave for an hour and a half and then you lose money then they come back which they were nice enough give you a refund which I said three times don't forget to put a note on number 11 dryer their reply was oh I'm going to see if I could fix it... Hopefully they did because of someone else loses money and they didn't fix it, it's all here in the review they only have one big washer it cost me 19 quarters to wash blankets but took 50 minutes to dry them when one of them was still a little damp. I think they should put the heater up or at least add 7 to 8 minutes per quarter and update your washer and dryers cuz they're old as  father time. lol. 
Thanks for Reading my Review.   ~Lizzie~
author: Lizzie G.

description:
Honestly, if I could give this place zero stars I would. Issues that I have with it include:

- The machines are never. ever. working. And they never have signs on them. I've put my clothes in a seemingly working dryer for over an hour, only to open it to soaking wet clothing because it doesn't heat up, etc. The ATM is also consistently broken, so have fun walking to 24th if you need any cash for quarters. 

- The service here is atrocious. The woman is always extremely rude and unhelpful if there is any issue related to the laundry machines. She actively ignores customers to talk with her friends. 

- It's expensive, and increasingly so. You would think by raising the prices and removing half the washing machines they would be able to fix some, but no. 

- They don't have iced coffee. 

PLEASE someone open a friendlier, more efficient laundromat in Noe Valley. I don't even care if it doesn't have a cafe and smug barista tending to it! I don't want to give this place my service any longer :(
author: Emily B.

description: Very friendly and outgoing young lady who works here and like the ability to get a hot beverage and donuts while I do the laundry. The only real issues quite a few broke units dryers and the Giant Loader will come back like the feel of the place which is due to a great employee who call you by your name and makes you feel welcome.
author: Dennis C.

description: ive done my laundry here for years. But, due to the old machines, broken dryers and general neglect of the laundry area I'm moving on. The owner is obviously only focusing on and maintaining the cafe part of this location. I wouldn't really call it a laundry mat anymore.
author: brett o.

description:
I have used this laundromat weekly for over a year, but it has really gone downhill recently.  Half the smaller washing machines have been removed, the folding area has been ripped out, and half the machines no longer work, and are mostly not labeled as such.  I wasted so much money on dryers that produced no hot air last time that I will not be returning.  One reviewer mentioned that some of the washing machines are full of filthy water/sludge.  This is true, the owner knows about it, and tends to let them sit like that for weeks on end.  She used to have them repaired, but last time so many washers were gone/out of order that my 4-5 loads of laundry used every available, working machine.  

The coffee and snacks are good, and I like the owner, but the current situation is untenable for me.  Might return for coffee, but that's it.
author: Kathy K.

description: I don't know WHO is running this place now. They removed around 4 washing machines to add a kid drawing board?! It's not a daycare!!! There is NO free WiFi not ONE SINGLE outlet for you to charge ur phone!!! Who does that?! At least a third of the machines are broken down .....but if I want good coffee and doughnuts.....this is the place for you! But good luck getting laundry done!! Ridiculous!! Last time I come spend my $$ here.
author: Liza L.

description: Awesome!!!while doing your laundry, conveniently you can experience having the best coffee I've ever had and the friendliest service. The owner will always greet you with a smile. Seems like everyone that comes there knows everybody. The pastries and cookies are great as well. If you dreadfully need to do laundry and chill out at the same time, this is a must check out laundromat.
author: Irah L.

description:
This place is a dump. I've been coming here to do laundry in rusty machines occasionally since it was $2.75 a load. Sometimes I would get a stain from this rust and have to wash again. I stopped coming here.

I had to do some emergency washing here yesterday and they hiked the price up to $3.25 in a month. No fixed machines, no new machines. Same old unkept environment with no one present to help.

Another yelper was correct in that they only wash cold as the machines are mainly broken. This place is a rip off.
author: Erendira O.

description:
Is it a coffee shop? Is it a laundromat? Is it a neighborhood hangout?

The answer is... yes, it's all of the above.

There's nothing more local in Noe Valley than Spin City. It's THE destination for coffee, lattes, donuts, pastries, other cafe delights and of course, freshly cleaned laundry. As they say, "if you're truly in the Noe, then you know Spin City."

Their flagship drip-coffee is flavorful, intriguing and reliable. I'd stick in an IV and pump it all day long if that were appropriate. The beans are all sourced locally and ground on the spot, making for a genuinely fresh cup of joe.

Their baked goods, which are sourced from various local bakers, are not your typical run-of-the-mill pastries. Each item has a unique twist that makes it especially delectable. Two personal favorites of mine are the Lemon Buttermilk Powdered Donut and the Maple Glazed Bacon Apple Donut (both from Dynamo).

Last but certainly not least, the baristas at Spin City are always inviting and open to making pleasant small talk if your java has you feeling chatty. And if you're a furry, four-legged friend then you are more than likely to receive a tasty treat upon your visit! Woof woof yum!

So whether you're a Noe Valley local, someone passing through the hood, or just a guy or gal with a giant bag full of dirty laundry, Spin City has something for you.
author: Chris G.

description: The first time I came here I got quarters stuck in a washing machine and then made it worse by sticking a piece of paper in to try to wedge it all the way in, getting both the paper and the quarter stuck. I was embarrassed, but when the owner came over, I was pleasantly surprised by how kind she was. She helped me fix the machine and, in the couple of visits I've made since, I've noticed that she makes it a point to be accessible to customers and confirm that everything's going smoothly. Yes, sometimes machines aren't working, but they're always labeled as such, and I've never had to wait for a machine. The place is adorable and the donuts and coffee? So good.
author: Chris S.

description: Good quality coffee, I got a latte and it was comparable to blue bottle or fourbarrel. Don't get fooled by the laundromat, the prices are $$$.
author: Dejana B.

description: This place is the best, clean your clothes, hop on the internet, drink some coffee, eat a tasty snack, talk to friendly strangers... everything that I didn't know I wanted in my neighborhood laundromat. The machines have always been in working order too.
author: Daniel M.

description:
Spin City Coffee is a rather charming and unique neighborhood spot to grab a coffee to go. It's also a great place if you don't have a washer/dryer or if your appliances break down. You can enjoy a cup of coffee while being productive and doing your laundry. Customer service is friendly and in two visits I noticed that regular customers were greeted and recognized immediately by the barista. The majority of the space is the laundromat area. 

The coffee station is in a small corner that may fit potentially two people, but one comfortably. They serve delicious Blue Bottle Coffee, the Americano is delicious! The line can get long pretty quick, so you may have to wait, but it's worth it. I was enjoying Pink Martini playing while I waited for my coffee. 

I love donuts but don't eat them often... Though the fact that the serve a sampling of Dynamo Donuts close to my home may change that! I learned the hard way that they only serve donuts on Wednesdays through Sundays. I am a fan of the lemon pistachio donut and maple bacon. There is more of a selection of Dynamo Donuts on Saturdays.
author: Nova P.

description:
I enjoy multi-purpose spaces. There's a place in Oakland's fruitvale neighborhood which has a taqueria inside a laundromat and that works.

I guess this is the same concept, Spin City Coffee has a setup in front of the laundromat and you can get coffee, espresso drinks and pastries while doing a load of laundry.  

The staff seem friendly and they serve Blue Bottle Coffee, good combination!
author: Mike L.

description:
I did something I have never done before.  I went to a public laundromat.  And I liked it.

Since my 2nd year of college, I've sent my laundry out for wash 'n' fold OR have lived places with a W/D inside my apartment.  On the east coast, for 20-some years--in several cities--wash 'n' fold has been a constant delight. The laundry is whisked away, and returns beautifully folded and sorted (often according to color, sox rolled in neat balls, etc.). It's an indulgence almost as satisfying as a full-body massage. 

But here in San Francisco, it's been a battle. For 4 years, I've used wash 'n' fold services all over the City, and the results have not once been as good as:  (a) I would do myself with my own washer and dryer, or (b) east coast laundry services.  

Most recently---I gave them 10 tries---was Rinse. The customer service cannot be improved upon---the delivery aspect is par excellence, bar none.  The **laundry** is mediocre at best. On the east coast I would expect and get A or A+ laundry returned to me.  With all the services in San Francisco, including Rinse, it was at very best B- and more likely a C or C+.

So------for the first time in my life---I realized I had to actually GO to a public laundromat. I put it off for 6 weeks, until I had not one shred of clothing to wear,  I dreaded the prospect---and hoped this wasn't a sign I was coming down in the world. Next I would be selling pencils and plastic mugs on Mission Street. 

I Yelped highest rated places, and looked at photos. I liked that this place has coffee. The photos were encouraging. Noe Valley isn't my hood or my peeps, but likely the least offensive place in the City to go to a public laundromat.  Couldn't have been more right.

 Spin City Launderette & Coffee Bar  is so awesome.  Had a refreshing flavorful cold-pressed coffee ($4) and a couple of unreal cookies, hooked up to WiFi, and proceeded to navigate the system----getting quarters----figuring out the machines.  MaryCar the woman running the cafe was helpful in figuring things out, as were some of the charming literate friendly neighborhood patrons--all of whom seem to love MaryCar.  

For the first time in 4 years I have sparkling clean, perfectly done laundry---and it was totally painless. In fact, it was almost pleasant. And it was actually fun talking to such nice, interesting people.  Not "laundromat denizens"---the prospect of hanging out with for hours, as said, had led to 6 weeks of procrastination.  Clean, no smells, tons of room, sunny, plants, attractive art, and machines that got the job done. Who could ask for more. I am glad for such a pleasant experience. And will definitely be back!
author: Swiss C.

description:
Love this place! $2.5 for one big load! $0.75 for soap and $0.25 for 6 or 8 minuets in dryer. Very friendly price compared with other wash and fold places. 

Their coffee is so good!! It will compete so bad with some really coffee shops! But note that though the laundry close at around 11, their coffee guys leave at around 4. Next time I'll definitely go get a bag of coffee beans.
author: Yifan J.

description: Nothing worked. Half of the washing machines were out of order. The ones we used didn't clean the clothes properly. And we didn't overfill them. We had to rinse out our clothes by hand in the bathroom to get the suds out. Shirts still had deodorant stains on them. The dryers didn't heat properly, and then when our cash ran out, the ATM was broken. The food and coffee did not make up for it. We will not be back.
author: Megan N.

description:
The place itself is Amazing. Ambiance is great, decor is great and the coffee shop, chill counter and wifi make this the place to visit. 

Why 2 stars?
This business should not be called Spin City. It should be called "The cleaning guy closes when he wants to laundry". I showed up at 10:20pm. Hours posted say it closes at 11pm. As I'm writing this review Yelp tells me "this place closes in 27 minutes"! However the guy turned me away from throwing a wet Tshirt I had in the dryer. He said it was closed at 10:20pm. 

This is not my first bad experience with him. He has:
- once watched me unload a machine and said that it looked like I placed too much clothes in it. He said that the machine would overload, catch fire, fire department would be called and I would be sued for damage and arrested for arson.

- after starting laundry at 8pm, he entered at 9:45pm and noticed I was drying clothes. He told me the neighbors upstairs were crazy and that they would call the police if I was still there at 11pm. He said police would write me a ticket and possibly place me under arrest for disturbing the peace. 

- once told me stories of all the bad experiences he had with "black people" at laundromats he services, including getting robbed. I am not black, but was deeply offended. 

Good guy, but his specialty is cleaning and getting home on time, not following this business hours or customer service. Business should ask him what he wants to do instead of posting false hours on door.
author: Johnny C.

description: I love Spin City! The coffee is delicious, you can buy local Noe Valley honey, and the staff is the BEST. There is not a week that I don't stop in. SC also has amazing donuts (passionfruit is my fave)!
author: F H.

description:
This place is adorable!  It suffices as both a small coffee and and pastry shop (the coffee is local -- roasted in a tiny place in the neighborhood) and a laundromat.  You can stop by just for the coffee.  And it is sunny, cute, and well-maintained.  There are even books to read.

The owner is accommodating and friendly, and introduced herself to me and told me she had moved to the city with only a few bucks in her pocket and started this business from scratch -- which is hard to do in this damn city.  

Thanks for still existing, btw!  Not everyone here owns their own house, complete with a washer and drier.

Pro-tip:  Change machine is hidden in the very back left, on the wall.
author: Elle T.

description: Amazing coffee, awesome baristas, and super tasty pastries. There's a reason people are always smiling here.
author: Kay M.

description: This friendly neighborhood laundromat is also an unnecessarily good coffee shop.  And they have goat milk.
author: Ian S.

description: It was my first time doing laundry in SF, and walked into a laundromat in the Mission and literally threw up in my mouth. I decided to find the antithesis of that dump, and Yelp lead me to the oasis that is spin city. I had to blink quite a few times and pinch myself to make sure I wasn't dreaming when I walked in this place! Immaculate-yes! Free wifi-yes!! Cheap locally roasted coffee-yesssss!! Dynamo donuts-YASSSSSSS!!! Plenty of machines, folding space, and cafe seating. The owner Maricar is so delightful as well that I would probably come to this haven even if I didn't need to do laundry just to sip a dirty chai, munch on a donut, and chat. I actually can't wait to come back, I don't think anyone has ever said that about a laundromat before!
author: Alisa W.

description:
I absolutely love this place. The service is incredible and the space is clean. It doesn't get better than this AND you're supporting a local business.

BONUS - the wash and fold service (while pricier than other options) is THE only one I would take my things to. The quality of the products and the folks actually doing the laundry cannot be beat. Pay a little more now - pay a lot less to replace your clothes later (other wash and folds ruin clothes).
author: Jessica J.

description:
I can't tell you how disappointed I am! This place used to be a great place to do your laundry. It was clean, kinda hip, parking is easy, but...

I've been coming here once a week for the past four years and slowly over time all the top-loaders are breaking and not being repaired or replaced! As I sit waiting for my laundry to dry and writing this review, I am sitting on one of FIVE broken washers, in a bank of EIGHT washers total!!! One of the washers I used sat on "23 minutes" for five minutes. I have to check the agitators in every machine I use because they shake loose and you end up with cloths that just sat in soapy water...

If you're not going to fix them, how 'bout replacing them?

I guess they want us to use the front loaders that take twice as long and cost twice as much and take 3 loads at a time?! I don't have that much laundry sometimes! Not everyone has a HUGE family! 

The driers are getting pretty beat too. It's taking 45 minutes to dry one set of towels!

I also find having the coffee shop there annoying rather than pleasant. The gal who runs it is only nice to you if you're buying something or have a dog. The music they play is annoying, and the coffee shop sounds and smells are annoying...

The free wi-fi doesn't work well either! And I couldn't find an outlet to save my life!

It's just a bummer going there now!

I think I'm going to try someplace else next week...
author: Jennifer C.

description: I love this concept. Great coffee, baked goods, wifi, books, atm machine, clean bathroom and laundry machines. I don't mind coming here and finishing up some work.  The place is nice and clean too. The Barista is exceptionally warm and welcoming.
author: Sbeen A.

description:
Dear Maricar - 

Thank you for your delicious latte with goat's milk, for your friendly smile and for your warm welcome in the morning. You truly make this a great neighborhood spot.
author: Wendy L.

description: I love this place. It is off the main 24th St corridor which I love. I can make a quick parking and jump in to get a great coffee. Mary, the owner, is always super warm and welcoming and now she often has staff at the coffee bar and they are super nice too. The launderette is clean and welcoming, with books and windows and airy. She has put in seating too. Just a super pleasant neighborhood experience. Support our locals!!!
author: Sandra H.

description: There isn't a whole lot of seating, and I can't speak for the laundry side of things. But I know the coffee is good if I don't have to add creamer or sweetener to it. I had a nice cup of pour over coffee from a blend recommended by a staff member. Tasty!
author: Anna M.

description: Maricar, owner, is the most lovely barista in Noe Valley! She brings a great energy and splendid craft to make exquisite coffee! I've only indulged in the unique, Iced NOLA, a rich, chicory infused coffee blend with origins from New Orleans! A trip to Noe is incomplete without a visit to this quaint, hidden gem on the corner of 26th and Sanchez! The adjoining laundromat is very clean and generally quiet in the morning hours.
author: William H.

description: Convenient, clean, and SUPER friendly. Loved that I could enjoy great coffee, a gourmet doughnut, and wifi while I waited. Would totally recommend.
author: Anna B.

description: Super cute space but completely ineffective as a laundromat. Three different washing machines ate my quarters so I spent $6 trying to find a machine that worked correctly to run a $2.50 load. SUPER frustrating. While the space is cool, it's not worth the hassle. Not coming back again. Save yourself the trouble and just go to a Pride Laundromat.
author: Maddi A.

description: Have been meaning to come here (since it's literally across the street from my house) but I just never think to go. This morning while waiting for someone to come to come my house I decided I needed coffee so I walked over and I got a mocha. It is delicious! They have a small assortment of pastries - donughts, sea salt chocolate chip cookies, jam bars I think... They do their drip coffee as a pout over and use blue bottle coffee. If you need to do laundry it's perfect for a cup of coffee and laundry day. The owner, maricar, is awesome and so are her employees  I should really think. Of coming more for my morning cup of coffee
author: Rosie S.

description: No signs for costs or duration, they wouldn't break a $20 bill for the quarters machine. Bit money grabby and spoilt good will. Shame. Will have to find somewhere else.
author: John H.

description:
The laundromat smells like the quaint coffee shop you have around the block! The guy in the coffee stall is very friendly! But about all the bathroom is CLEAN!

The neighborhood is nice and it is really easy to find parking! The food looks delicious and smells great! They also have places for you to lounge - a sofa and a table with chairs! It's perfect if you want to sun bathe on a Saturday afternoon while getting your chores done! 

Highly recommend!
author: Andersen Y.

description: Incredible coffee!!! The lattes and pour over are both fantastic. Honestly some of the best I've ever had! The baristas are super friendly and its dog friendly too. My dog drags me in to get a treat haha! Can't say anything about the laundromat itself but I love the space and the friendly neighborhood atmosphere.
author: Rachel R.

description:
I love this tiny corner coffee shop. The owner Maricar and barista Zac are always friendly and welcoming. The coffee is delish and they have the best donuts on the planet - Dynamo Donuts!!! I've tried most of their other goods too - big fat chocolate chip cookies, moist cupcakes, homemade poptarts - and I have never been disappointed. When I was living down the street I'd come in the mornings and drag one of the comfy Adirondack chairs into the sunshine and bask as I enjoyed my treats. 

Highly recomended! Support your neighborhood coffee shops and treat yourself to quality!
author: Michelle P.

description: Check out this cool launderette! Coffee is delicious and the staff is super friendly! Sit in- or ourside, use the wifi, have a coffee while your laundry is spinning!
author: Marjan E.

description:
Spin City is about 200 feet away from our house, so it's our go-to coffee and pastries spot in spite of the fact that we do all our laundry at home. I never would have thought that my fave coffee place would be inside a laundromat, but I guess that's San Francisco for you.

Maricar, the owner of the coffee bar and one of the two baristas, is super friendly. She always greets me and my little dog (oh yeah, you can take your dog; I mean, it is Noe Valley...) with a big smile and treats for the pup. She's funny, unpretentious, and outgoing, and as if that all weren't enough, she also makes great coffee. The other barista Zach is also wonderful. Not an ounce of attitude from either of them, unlike a lot of other high-end coffee places. 

They also have delicious pastries from local vendors. These aren't your regular City Bake selection - there's Dynamo Donut, sea salt chocolate chip cookies, peanut butter cupcakes...awesome stuff.

Last bit of loveliness: there is a real sense of neighborhood community in here. It's rare that I come in without chatting with some of the other patrons and laundrydoers. I haven't found that vibe in many other places in Noe; suffice it to say that Spin City is doing something right :)
author: Sophi S.

description:
Espresso and latte tasting are among my favorite activities when on vacation. It's so sad that San Francisco isn't a coffee city. I visited a number if recommended coffee shops and finally found the second place (after at least 10 attempts and really enjoyed blue bottle) with going. Spin city laundry is such a pleasant surprise!  It's also the only place I know that brews coffee in cold for the iced coffees (Nola). 

Lastly, the pastries are also great!
author: Danny D.

description: Smiling happy people making Blue Bottle coffee and serving Dynamo donuts...the best place to get a coffee on a beautiful weekend in Noe; tons of warm fuzzies each time I go!
author: David S.

description:
Getting a latte and a vegan pastry at Spin City makes my day.  And chatting up with the friendliest baristas makes it even better.

AND, you can use your cell phone (square) to pay.

I love Spin City!
author: Yoko S.

description: Delicious coffee near our family doctor, found through google maps and the yelp reviews did not disappoint! Thought of walking to Starbucks down the street SO HAPPY that I decided to try this place out!  Wonderful friendly inviting atmosphere with an owner who had treats for customers puppies and knew everyone in line by name and their orders. I was quite pleased just to interact with them all so happy I stopped in. And the coffee ?delicious! Such a unique flavor, perfect temperature, hits the spot! Definitely recommendable and will be back !
author: Jess H.

description: I guess I would give this place another shot just because there are a many good reviews but I gave it 2 stars because many of the machines were broken and I only came here because I could get coffee and do laundry in the morning at the same time. I filled the machines I needed first because I was afraid I wouldn't get machines since so many were out of order. By the time I loaded my laundry in the guy at the coffee counter was gone and there was a closed sign in the little window... I waited for close to 10 minutes but he did not return so I walked to gross coffee 4 blocks away. When I got back he had reopened the coffee bar, annoying that there was no way for me to know to wait, no posted hours of operation or "be right back" sign. Not the worst experience but the two things this place offers were lacking. Also there was, um, unflushed waste in the toilet and no paper towels in the bathroom.
author: Michelle R.

description:
This is my favorite place to get coffee because I really love the people - Maricar is awesome.  OMG SO MANY YUMMY TREATS!!!! 
 It is perfect to do laundry because you can get all fired up on caffeine and get your clothes done in half the time!  Ha!
author: Apaulo H.

description:
Sometime after my third apartment without dedicated washer/dryer units somewhere in the building, I started making it a prerequisite.  

I like dryer lint and the smell of clean clothes just as much as the next gal but SF laundromats are a breed apart.  There's nothing quite like sitting next to the washer for an hour to make sure your clothes don't disappear.  Who steals clothes?  And why is it always underwear? Oh, and the methheads.  What is up with junkies and SF laundromats?

I'm not big on the SF laundromat scene...BUT

I do love blue bottle coffee. And it's Noe Valley so you can rest assured that Spin City is at least 90% meth free.
author: Melissa Y.

description:
As mundane as your laundromat experience can be, Spin City almost makes it something to look forward to. Get there on the early side to get your selection of Dynamo donuts, empanadas, or home-baked pop tarts while watching your clothes spin. They also serve Blue Bottle coffee. It's a pretty swanky operation, considering the setting. 

The machines are super clean, and I've never experienced any of them breaking down. They also offer free wifi.
author: Rachel F.

description:
My husband and I used to do our laundry here when we lived in an
apartment that had no washer or dryer. Back then, the only thing you
could do at this laundromat was your laundry. There was a little
corner that looked like it had once housed a mini cafe of some kind,
but really, there were tumbleweeds all up in that place.

We wish Maricar and her amazing little coffee boutique had been there
when we were laundry customers! We can only imagine what fun it would
have been to sip delicious hot beverages and snack on dynamic donuts
whilst washing our linens. It would have taken the sting out of losing
an entire weekend afternoon to laundry!

We still live in the area, though, so we will enjoy her offerings not
as laundry-doers, but as regular folks just strolling on by.

Incidentally, I had the HOT CHOCOLATE today and it was the BEST HOT
CHOCOLATE I have ever had. Thank you.
author: Jessica L.

description: Awesome coffee with a wonderful vibe.  A great neighborhood hub run by an inspiring female entrepreneur.
author: Sarah C.

description:
Gah! What has taken me so long to write this review? (Sorry, Maricar!) I guess I just forgot about Yelp for a couple years but since they wen't public yesterday, I suppose I'm due for writing a couple of reviews?

This place is awesome. Noe Valley is kind of a wasteland when it comes to coffee, with the exception of this place. No offense to the fans of Martha's but they don't know diddly about making espresso...

Before Spin City, I would have to get in my car and drive to Ritual over in the Mission to get a good espresso-based drink. Not any more. Maricar and her team know how to pull a great shot and are using (arguably) the best coffee beans on the planet.

Even if I didn't like the coffee here, my dog would drag me inside anyway because he loves the treat. He also rates this five stars.
author: Jason Y.

description:
Perhaps the smallest Blue Bottle location in the city? I can't say for sure, but do not judge it on its size; the coffee here is fantastic. Sure, you may have to watch someone folding their unmentionables while you wait for your delicious brew, but that just adds to the charm.  

Really, this place has everything you want in a coffee bar: a super friendly barista, great coffee, typically little to no wait and some tasty pastries (including Dynamo Donuts and gourmet Pop Tarts) if you're into that sort of thing.  I've never been much of a coffee guy, but now I'm a bit of a snob: anything less than a coffee from the Spin City Blue Bottle just doesn't quite cut it.
author: Eric S.

description:
Dirty laundry.

Bring it.

Air it.

Or just duck inside on a cold afternoon for warm coffee (Blue Bottle Americano is just $2.25 and goes down smooth) and warm service (such friendly staff).

Coffee gets four stars. Concept earns them five.
author: Jason B.

description: Great hole in the wall cafe with blue bottle, yummy pastries and super friendly service.
author: Elana R.

description: Best coffee in Noe Valley by far. Super friendly!
author: JawkDNA X.

description:
I love this place.  I love the owner.  I love the coffee.  I love the carefully curated selection of treats.  It was a happy day when Maricar opened her little business in the corner of Spin City Laundry.  Not to be cheesy, this business has really brought a community together.  Makes for a super friendly place to visit whenever I need caffeine or a friendly smile!

Support this wonderful, local business and support good feelings in the neighborhood!
author: S.T. C.

description:
Yay! Spin City Coffee is back! They're featuring Blue Bottle Coffee for drip and espresso drinks. The owner, Maricar is a total sweetheart with a big smile who serves up your beverage with TLC and even gave us little pillow mints the other day. It's mostly for take-out but there are benches out front and one table with chairs inside. 

They've got a page on Facebook too for more info:
http://www.facebook.com/SpinCityCoffee
author: Ronald G.

description: My only concern is the top neighbor who lives in the same building gets pissed if you don't stop drying your clothes passed 10pm.
author: Saul G.

description: Great find in a random laundry place. Barista was nice and I enjoyed my breve. They have some baked goods and doughnuts are delivered on some days of the week.
author: Xteethx B.

description: I absolutely love this place.  I live in Excelsior & drive up here with my laundry to grab coffee & explore Noe while my clothes are doing their thing.  Blue Bottle coffee, awesome baristas & a great neighborhood.  The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because the washers are very often broken and there are not that many, so when three go down, that's a huge percentage of them not working.  The laundromat manager is very nice & helpful when he is there, though.
author: Kris Y.

description:
Here I am in Spin City, losing my laundromat virginity. 
The washer in my building's garage has been broken for a week and I'm running out of my good underpants. I'm glad Spin City is just a quick walk down the street from me (the walk home will be less pleasant---damn you, Noe Valley hills). Since they serve Blue Bottle Coffee, I have a tasty goat milk cafe au lait in my hand and they're playing good old Billie Holiday in the background. I had assumed laundromats would all play dental office-status music. You know, of the "lite rock, less talk" variety. Secretly though, I love getting my teeth drilled to the tunes of Michael Bolton and Atlantic Starr.
Anyway...
Now a typically cute Noe Valley toddler is playing peekaboo with me. So yes, this is Noe Valley and having to go to the laundromat is not so bad.
author: Marissa B.

description: The best organic coffee (only organic coffee?) in Noe. And way friendly service too. I stop in even when I've already made coffee at home because Mary is great energy (and my puppy loves her too).
author: Pam P.

description: I love this place!  So convenient, down to earth, and yet fully stocked with quality coffees and pastries.  Maricar is so sweet and friendly and really knows her products.
author: beverly l.

description: A few blocks from the house and amazing coffee every time we stop in. Bluebottle coffee with a short wait.
author: Mario P.

description: Great coffee, excellent hand picked assortment of pastries, and top notch service -- not to speak of a very nice neighborhood!
author: Miguel L.

description:
I hate doing laundry, especially when I have SEVEN loads to do, but Spin City Launderette helps make the laundry chaos a little more bearable. The price is only fifty cents more than when I do laundry at home, but it's  well worth it when it saves me hours of laundry time! Moreover, I love the coffee shop that's in the Launderette. Like my quick tip said: Go for the sea-salt chocolate chip bars! 

Another quick tip that a frequent Spin City patron passed on to me: Washer #14 is a problem washer! The water doesn't fill up all the way, only about half. Use it for only about five items!
author: Daisy D.

description: I have been here a few times now. I actually drive across town to do my laundry here,because I like the vibe of the place, And I can get a coffee. Unfortunately they don't care about posted hours, closed at 4 today. Oh well 2 stars for my other positive visits.
author: Travis H.

description:
Excellent Coffee, and thanks for donating your tips to the rescue event today.

I would recommend to anyone who lives in the area or driving by to get a cup of coffee.
author: Dean C.

description:
What a cool idea! I find it hard to believe that every laundromat doesn't offer coffee.

I have a washer in my building, so no need for a laundromat, but I did stop by for a very interesting goat's milk latte ($3.75).  The lady at the counter was super nice and did a great job. But honestly, as much as I love goat byproducts, I don't think that lattes are the right use for them.  There's something weird about the sourness of their milk when mixed with bitter coffee.

It as a cute place and the latte was well-executed, but next time I'd get the regular milk instead.  And not on a Wednesday, because apparently they're closed.
author: Mari C.

description:
Mary is only the friendliest lady ever!

The blue bottle coffee rocks, and I definitely need to get a Dynamo donut on my next visit.  Great addition to the 'hood!
author: Vicente G.

description:
I'm lucky enough to have washer/dryer at home so the launderette attached to this tiny cafe is neither here nor there. The tiny cafe on the other hand is a gawd send - here's why...

1. There's a serious lack of really good coffee in the neighborhood (yes, Martha's is independent but the coffee is crap and you know it).

2.  Blue Bottle!!!

3. The proprietor is genuinely nice - I tried to bait her, but she just wouldn't diss the crappy coffee that passes for good around here. 

4. Do you really need any more reasons?
author: Prattle P.

description:
I stopped in here in the middle of a somewhat hard afternoon and was genuinely touched by the kind and warm manner of the woman working the counter. She really made my day better. 

On the food front, the green tea latte was great, and there were splendid gluten free doughnuts. The kindness, though, will stick with me.
author: Andie Z.

description: I just had such a happy experience at this Laundromat there are closer laundromats to my house but this one is much better . Generally doing laundry is awful but this place has a cute coffee shop in it with pastries and books to puruse while you wait. The coin machine is always working. There are plenty of machines in working condition, unlike other laundromats nearby. And  plenty of space to sit and wait for laundry, a table and couch.
author: Maria J.

description:
I get my espresso here literally every morning and it is wonderful! Both coffee (Blue Bottle) and preparation (which is equally important in order to make a good espresso, if not more so) are awesome. I've also had the ice latte with goat milk twice, and it was excellent.

Recently donuts from Dynamo Donuts have been added to the menu, so I'm happy.

To top all of this, Marie is an amazing, super friendly person.
author: Yair L.

description:
After Dynamo Donuts made it big by getting featured in one of the food shows, the wait for these greasy sugary treat has been unbearable - or so I was told.  But those are for tourists (who are brave enough to go beyond the confines of Union Square and venture out to the real SF that is the MIssion District).  My wait takes less than 5 minutes at the nearby Spin City.  Score.

AND here I actually get to have my Blue Bottle latte in less than one-tenth of what it would normally take an average customer to get his at the coffee stand at Ferry Building Saturday Farmer's Market.  Double score.

Did I say the latte is spiked with the uber-delicious goat milk? Triple score.

I heart Spin City.
author: Ange L.

description:
Blue Bottle coffee with goat milk latte? Yes, that's about as good as it gets! Plus the barista is super friendly. Win win win.
Yum.
author: Katie D.

description: Apparently the coffee part is great here, but the laundry is decrepit. Half of the top loaders have been broken for over a year, and at some point the dryers were turned down to 6min per quarter. I have to wonder if the owner has a gambling problem or something.
author: E H.

description: Spin City has the best coffee in town, and the nicest people. I have not washed clothes there, but I regularly visit the Cafe, which occupies only a small corner of the place. There are tables to sit, some books and games, and awesome coffee and treats from Dynamo Donuts, Empanadas, gluten free and vegan cookies, and fancy pop tarts. And, of course, Blue Bottle coffee. Awesome all around.
author: Martin W.

description: Maricar is the mayor on Sanchez and 26th St.!
author: Pant SF T.

description: This place is super convenient for me, but aside from that they make good coffee.  They are also really friendly.  They're also embracing technology and accepting payments from Square's Card Case.
author: J K.

description: Best coffee in Noe, no holds barred; miles better than Bernie's, Martha's or Starbucks. Friendly service as well, as others have said. I can't vouch for the launderette, but discovered this Blue Bottle outpost on a recent jog through the neighborhood and will be a regular from now on.
author: Pria W.

description: Cute, clean little laundromat.  I've come one three different occasions, at different times of the day/week and its always been easy to get a washer/dryer.  Haven't had any issues with any of the machines yet.  Looks like i'll keep coming back, just have to remember not to eat before coming here so i can have some blue bottle and dynamo :)
author: Lesliegh H.

description: In a neighborhood otherwise devoid of good espresso, Spin City is a true gem. It's super friendly baristas create a list of espresso drinks as well as pour-over coffees (all blue bottle). There is rarely a line of more than a couple people, so no worries if you are in a bit of a rush. Grateful to have this place in Noe.
author: Marshall R.

description: Now I enjoy doing laundry. They serve Blue bottle coffee and have free wifi. Never too crowded.
author: Isabelle C.

description: I can't say enough nice things about this coffee shop.  Maricar might as well be the mayor of Noe Valley and her passion and knowledge about the Blue Bottle coffee she serves is infectious.  Highly recommend this gem!
author: Elizabeth A.

description: My favorite coffee in the city.  The owner is amazingly friendly, the Blue Bottle coffee is top notch (and available with none of the wait of other BB locations around the city), and the edibles are incredible (Dynamo Donuts, gourmet chocolate chip cookies, vegan coffee cakes, etc.). There's also something indefinably charming and secret about getting amazing coffee in a launderette. Highest recommendation.
author: Julio A.

description:
Ignore bottom review from 2007-it's outdated. No more long drives and searching for parking for Blue Bottle Coffee, you can get it good, fresh drip, on the corner of 26th and Sanchez streets. 
Nice, clean laundry mat too,
author: Mel B.

description: Maricar and Zach are awesome. Great Blue Bottle coffee served up in a friendly neighborhood atmosphere. Plus Dynamo Donuts, Kind Bars and other snacks.
author: Ben M.

description: Yes. You can find blue bottle coffee in Noe Valley. If you don't look hard enough, you can easily miss this place. It's a tiny kiosk in the corner of the laundromat? Anyway, got a great tasting cup of coffee, a bag of beans, and they had a small selection of Dynamo Donuts with no lines! SCORE!!! Also, the lady working at the booth is super nice and educated me on the different blends. I'll be back soon.
author: Fil L.

description: FABULOUS coffee, thank you for being there....  and for being SO amazingly wonderful!!!
author: linda b.

description:
I live in Excelsior and I drive 2 miles just to do laundry here because its usually chill during the day or at night before closing, and there aren't a zillion little brats running around, screaming their heads off. Theres a couch near the back that you can either crash on or zone out to the washers spinning in front of you, or there are tables and chairs in the front. There is also a bathroom, but its only available when the manager is around. 

I usually like to walk the few block to 24th, grab a snack, and by the time i return, my laundry is done. Street parking is fairly easy in the area and I always feel safe here. If you come during the day, you can grab some coffee from the cafe and people watch all the stay at home moms dragging their strollers down the street. I dont do that though, I just read or stare at my phone.

Dryers are $.25 for 7 minutes and $2.25 for the top loaders. And in case you ever need some clothes, theres always a pile of leftovers towards the back of the laundromat....ya know, in case you ever need...extra...clothes.
author: Kelly K.

description: The washer /dryer portion opens at 7am, closes as 11pm (last wash 9:30pm).  Really clean!  Though I just moved here from Manhattan, so my standards are probably lower. :-)
author: Liz E.

description:
If you need to do your laundry at Spin City, don't forget to bring the following:

1. Quarters: The last two times I've been there. The machine was broken. You'll have to go to the bank on 24th street to get money. Oh...and you'll need to get some extra quarters for the shop, since the guy who works there will ask you to change money for him (I'm not kidding).

2. Coffee: The cafe hasn't been open for the last few years that I've been going there. No big deal but then don't put "Coffee Bar" in the title. 

3. A Pollyanna attitude: You'll need it. The owner (or manager, I'm not sure) got really, really defensive when I told him that the quality of the joint has gone down a bit since the new owner took over. This was after the second dryer I put my clothes in conked out. He told me to "Go somewhere else if I don't like it". Nice. Guess he hasn't heard of Yelp.

But here's the bright side: Going to Spin City Launderette will finally convince you to buy a washer and dryer for your apartment. It did for me. So they get two stars for that.
author: Kelly B.

description: Maricar and Spin City coffee are awesome.  We don't use the launderette, but we've made the trek here on the weekends for coffee. As Prattle P. points out, the coffee options in Noe Valley are, ahem, underwhelming, so Spin City is a welcome addition.  Blue Bottle Coffee, tasty baked goods, and friendly service - nice!  Mary remembered my son's name, and had organic treats for our dog.
author: Blake M.

description: How exciting.  The coffee bar in this space is FINALLY open.  Everyday but Wednesday.  Even more exciting?  It's Blue Bottle Coffee!  It's a women-owned and stocked with fresh pastries.  Welcome to the neighborhood!
author: Kelli R.

description: because of the tiny cafe, there is a person there to help if there are problems with the laundry machines. they are friendly. the wifi is good. what else do you need?  its my regular laundromat.
author: Tom R.

description: Blue bottle coffee at this ultra friendly ultra  small coffee shop. The machiato is delicious.
author: Diego V.

description: Clean facility. Fairly standard pricing as far as laundry goes.  Blue Bottle coffee and treats for sale.  Wi-fi. Manager is very warm and friendly
author: Alex T.

description: I have had their gluten free donuts as well as the tea cake. The coffee is fantastic...but it really is the friendly shop owner who makes all the difference. Great place!
author: Lisa C.

description: I went with a friend to Spin City who had mentioned the Goat Milk Latte and Macaroons.  I ordered a usual regular cup of coffee and from the corner of my eye, I saw her look at me totally perplexed.  She immediately asked in disdain, "Why did you NOT order the Goat Milk Latte?" Having been brought back to reality, I changed my order.  At first I didn't add agave syrup, but decided to go the distance.  Before I reached the door, I had consumed half of the drink.  She offered me a taste of the macaroon, and proceeded to nearly finish the elixir.  Never had I a better caffeinated drink.  Thank you Lady Katherine, and 5 stars to spin (10 if the option were available!)
author: Matt L.

description: Wow! The best coffee and Muncie start to any day. Super people.
author: Ted D.

description: I haven't been here to do my laundry, but the new coffee shop that just moved in is wonderful. Marycar (the barista whose name I've probably massacred) is very knowledgeable about coffee and the different roasts that are available through my most beloved Blue Bottle Coffee. It's worth paying the $2.50 for a single cup of coffee when you see intricate steps taken to make it. I just hope that they stock up on beans. They had almost run out when I was there on Monday, and did not yet have any beans available to purchase. According to the barista, they will very soon. I will be going back on my morning walks!
author: Anne K.

description: as a cool down to earth lady i know in the past , Its great to see her again n become  a owner n try her line of blue bottle coffee (now if i'm ever around Sanchez  x  26 th u know where ill be having coffee)
author: RICHARD L.

description: We get our blue bottle beans here and always enjoy a friendly chat and whatever locally made tasty treats Maricar has found - donuts, cookies, honey...  I LOVE having a neighborhood place to get BB beans and it's a delight to visit.  Excellent coffee, excellent service... always fun to go bye.
author: Bret W.

description:
A great neighborhood laundermat for washing large comforters, pillows, etc.  I am fortunate to have my own washing machine and dryer, but I appreciate this laundermat being close to my home when larger machines are needed.
Also, a well lit and clean place...no graffiti!
author: D A.

description:
now that my mourning period for in-building laundry is over, i can say i'm thankful to live near spin city. new machines, clean and bright interior, wireless access, the list goes on... on top of that, i had forgotten the beauty of parallel processing - the time for doing 3-4 loads is THE SAME as doing 1 load. ingenious! 

the one gripe i have is that i usually do laundry on sunday mornings and the coffee bar is never open! that makes me sad and grouchy.... until i get to roll around in my pile of freshly dried clothes. whee!

one normal washer load is $2 and a quarter buys you about 8 min on the dryer. note: the change machine is integrated into the back wall (you would not believe how long it took us to figure that out the first time).
author: Angi C.

description: my first place in the new 'hood. Was fairly quiet on a sunday evening. clean place. missed the coffee part though.
author: Rashmi V.

description: Blue Bottle Coffee in the neighborhood with amazing customer service--yeah!  I like their lattes a lot although sometimes they aren't as hot as they should be.  It is such a treat to have this quality coffee within walking distance.
author: Barbara S.

description: Great coffee with great girl working there.  Mericar is so sweet and they serve blue bottle coffee.  I'm glad to have this place within walking distance of out home.
author: hannah b.

description: as i don't go to laundrymats to do my laundry, my review will be on the coffee bar located within the laundremat.  seriously good coffee. i mean, come on, it's blue bottle, after all!! the owner is really nice and makes a mean latte. they also carry dynamo doughnuts (but my doughnut around my waist doesn't need another doughnut to add to it!!!). the best part is if you are on the run, and don't want to deal with parking, there is a green zone right out front--so you can zip in, zip out and get your caffeine fix. Heyyyyyyyyyyyyyyy!
author: mary c.

description: good place. the only thing i don't like is the coffee shop. $3.50 for a dounut. expensive i think!
author: RODGER B.
